Pre-Game Insights: Utah Jazz aims to halt a 4-game losing streak as they face the New York Knicks.
The Knicks are 10-4 on their home court and are third in the Eastern Conference, scoring 117.8 points while shooting 49.7% from the field.
The Jazz have gone 5-12 away from home and are sixth in the Western Conference with 11.8 offensive rebounds per game, led by Walker Kessler averaging 4.0.
Karl-Anthony Towns is averaging 24.7 points, 13.5 rebounds, and 3.3 assists for the Knicks.
John Collins is averaging 17.7 points and 8.2 rebounds for the Jazz.
In their last 10 games, the Knicks have a 9-1 record, averaging 117.6 points, 45.6 rebounds, 28.0 assists, 8.6 steals, and 3.8 blocks per game while shooting 49.1% from the field.
In their last 10 games, the Jazz have a 3-7 record, averaging 116.7 points, 45.7 rebounds, 26.3 assists, 6.5 steals, and 5.7 blocks per game while shooting 47.8% from the field.
Mitchell Robinson is out for the Knicks due to an ankle injury.
John Collins is out for the Jazz due to a hip injury, and Taylor Hendricks is out for the season due to a fibula injury.
